author: @RealMcDudu
text: As for the Twitter different time - you can see it's some sort of a timezone difference - I mean, the mins / hours / mins ago are true (to some extent) but the time is for some reason set to be in UTC -10:00 - which is more or less Hawai. Probably there is some reason for it, but I can't think of any right now :-P

author: @thomasdetry3751
text:
Python 3.0 update;  import re from re import sub import time import urllib.request import http.cookiejar cj = http.cookiejar.CookieJar() opener = urllib.request.build_opener(urllib.request.HTTPCookieProcessor(cj)) opener.addheaders = [('User-agent', 'Mozilla/5.0')] keyWord = 'obama' startingLink = 'https://twitter.com/search?f=realtime&q=' endLink = '&src=typd' def main():     try:         source = opener.open(startingLink+keyWord+endLink).read()         #https://docs.python.org/3.4/library/stdtypes.html         sourceCode = str(source)         splitSource = re.findall(r'

(.*?)

', sourceCode)         for item in splitSource:             #print(item)             print('')             print('')             print('')             print('_______________________________')             print(re.sub(r'<.*?>','', item))             #time.sleep(555)                  except Exception as e:         print(e)         print('error in main loop')         time.sleep(555) main()
